Understudy club which helps youngsters in placements studies just as different occasions are likewise there in college. I am one of the individuals from the APTI club, which helps understudies planning for placements.

Name: Tanishq vaibhav
Heading: Kiet - a place where u will not regret to enter after 4 years if you work hard
Review: well all of us know that the I.T. industry is on the boom and the college KIET group of institution is famous for its branch information and technology . all the faculty are Ph.D. and M.tech level. the total intake is 1800 and 8:1 is student to faculty ratio. at each and every interval of time , we get notifications about various internship , internation internship as well about the hackathons organized by different colleges and companies. these notifications are sent to us by college mail id.at regular interval of time , CT and PUE are organized within the span of 6 months.

Name: TIWARI SHUBHAM KRISHNAKUMAR
College: Prime Institute of Engineering and Technology
Heading: Prime is the best.
Review: PIET is doing great in placements that's why many students tend to join here over other campus. The percentage of student placed for 90%. The highest package was 1.2 lakhs per year for a guy from computer branch and he got placed in Software job only. Many recruiters prefer PIET for placement because directors have stronge industrial background knowledge.

Name: APPANA PALLI YATISH DURGA
College: Prime Institute of Engineering and Technology
Heading: Wonderful Engineering college to begin your career
Review: I choose Mechanical Engineering as Prime college has the Most Advanced Mechanical Labs and one of the finest faculty. All the faculty have at least 3-4 years of experience and have deep knowledge of their specialization. All faculty have Master's degrees. faculty gives you practical knowledge about the subjects. Faculty provides Important questions for University examinations. 80 % of the questions come from Important questions due to which passing the exam was a piece of cake. College faculty takes you for an industrial visit due to which you learn the practical application of the machines.

Name: Tulika Mitra
College: Dr. Sudhir Chandra Sur Institute of Technology & Sports Complex - [SURTECH]
Heading: Very good College
Review:
I am a diploma holder in Electronics and telecommunication engineering. Then I took admission to Dr Sudhir Chandra Sur Institute of technology and sports complex B.tech in Electronics and communication engineering. in the year 2019.
Faculty: faculty members are very well Educated and highly educated. Their teaching quality is really good. Faculty members are very helpful to us. All faculty members are good. 
Examination: Examination is tough. But our faculty members provide us suggestions before the exams 
And they ake doubt clearing class before the examination. It helps us to make good marks in our Examinations.

Name: Ekjyot
College: Galgotias College of Engineering and Technology - [GCET]
Heading: About Galgotias College
Review: Fees were the same as of different Engineering colleges in the market. I did not receive any scholarship during my BTech, financial assistance from the college side was zero just colleges allow you to pay yearly fees in 2 instalments and for that, you have to take permission from the college director.

Name: divyansh
Heading: DPG college mega infrastructure and going to be best
Review: Annual fest 'Arpan is conducted in February. All books related to our course are provided by our college library. The library is well maintained and organized so the books are easy to find. Library also consists of newspapers and magazines in addition to books. Classrooms are fully air-conditioned and with comfortable seating arrangements. Our college consists of many sports activities cricket, basketball and football are some of them. There is seperate area maintained for each sports activity which is very attractive to me. Many inter-college competitions are conducted in our college and many festivals like Lohri and Diwali are celebrated.

Name: Iqra Khan
College: Ambalika Institute of Management and Technology - [AIMT]
Heading: My Review
Review:
Ambalika Institute of Management and Technology provides lots of fests, some technical fest too. At the starting of the session, they conduct freshers for the new students. Then they conduct an event as an intro as a formal interaction between junior and senior. In the end, they conduct an annual fest at the end of the session. And at the middle many tech fests took place. 
     They also conduct some sports events that took place for 3 days in the month of May. In the library, they provide all kinds of books that are helpful. We don't have to purchase books as Library provides us all.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: My college review
Review: A large diverse student body, more choices for majors & specialization, and more opportunities for future references. Our college environment is too healthy for study, 9 faculties are in our botany dept. out of the 2 are demonstrated. One lab assistant, and other teaching staffs the ratio of faculty: students are 1:5, teaching staffs are ph.D qualified & teaching quality is too friendly & well explained, easy to understand. Between 2 semesters there is a 6th-month gap & examinations are completed in a very strict manner.

Name: Kushagra Srivastava
College: Galgotias College of Engineering and Technology - [GCET]
Review:
My first choice was CSE but didn't get a Fee Waiver seat there and hence chose IT. At that time on the hindsight, I was worried about this decision of mine but now when I look back I feel it was a very good decision and both the courses are 99% similar. Faculty student ratio is pretty good. There were around 10-15 faculties for IT branch with 120 students. Many faculties were common for CSE and IT. Most of the faculties had masters degree with few having doctorate as well. Faculties were educated enough but barring one or two, rest of them had a traditional teaching style of forcing the students to memorize everything. Anyway in an engineering college, what u do outside of course curriculum matters more.
Term exams were very timely. And in my experience they were very easy to pass. Marks were given based on handwriting and how much pages u filled. No one really cared about the quality of answers.

Name: Pratik parmar
College: Sardar Vallabhbhai National Institute of Technology - [SVNIT]
Heading: Good college
Review: In one semester 2 exam's are there first is mid sem of 30 marks and the second is end sem which contains 50 marks and 20 Mark's for internal.midsem is conducted after 1.5 months and the same for end sem. if you are in odd sem mid sem in September mid and end sem in December starting and if you are in even semester mid sem in March starting and end sem in may starting..There are 2 vacations first is December second week to January first week and second is may mid to July end. exams are easy to clear and many chances for backlog exams and supplementary also make-up exams are there.

Name: Yash
College: Fairfield Institute of Management and Technology - [FIMT]
Heading: My college life-Fairfield Institute of Management and Technology
Review:
The annual fest is conducted in the month of August in the college itself which is organized by the college.

College also has a very good library which includes all the books and journals which students need so that can study properly.

College gives opportunities to participate in extracurricular activities so that the students can pursue their hobbies.

Name: Jay Mehta

The placements in the college is pretty average . Most of the students opt for higher studies abroad so very few good companies come for placements . It includes JP Morgan , Morgan stanley , TCS ,etc

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: Ambalika Institute of Management and Technology - [AIMT]
Heading: This review of mine reflects truth of the college
Review: This course has a good scope in this college as many National and International level companies offer jobs in this course such as AMAZON, MICROSOFT, IBM, etc. The student ratio is quite decent which is roughly 3-4 female students per 10 male students. The faculty here is highly qualified and has excellent teaching skills. Though students have different protective for teachers and their teaching methods, I believe faculty are providing quality education to the students as well as mentorship. Exams are frequent here to enhance the students' learning capabilities and the difficulty level is quite decent so that students have to work hard for their shining future.

Review: Fees have been hiked a lot seriously. It is now 80000 per annum which I find hard for my family and also they have bus facilities of 40000 which I have availed as I live far from the college. My income is not less that 2 lakh so scholarship is not for me.

Name: Surya Prakash

Review: The campus has a great infrastructure facility and provides digital classes, the campus is always clear and green. The campus had ranked first in Swatch Bharath Mission. I have just completed my first year online do not have much information about the offline as I have not been to campus yet. Various sports activities also have been conducted in cricket football and many other sports as well.

Amenities in the classroom - Modern classroom with a projector, new equipment from the industry for labs.

Apart from this Teacher's Day and Fresher's Welcome are also celebrated. Classrooms are spacious and airy.

There are varities of extra activities which are free of cost you can go through banasthali website all the activities are mentioned there I bet you will be amazed. Name: Rachit kumar
College: ISM Dhanbad - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITISM]
Heading: Review of my college
Review: The semester fee is 120700 and the hostel plus mess fee is 25200. And there is no problem in taking admission in the college if you have any financial problem because you will have plenty of opportunities to avail the of various type of scholarship. A tuition fee waiver is given to students with poor financial background. Students with family income less than 1 lakh and those between 1 - 5 lakhs are given 100 and 66 a waiver on tuition fee respectively. Students can also get their pocket money as there are many coaching centres near the campus where you can easily earn 400-500 per hour by sharing your knowledge.

Name: Nanda Kishore B

The classrooms and labs have all the infrastructure that you would look for like internet connectivity, proper systems with software and labs are air-conditioned. Students can also borrow any sports equipment from the sports department and there is always something happening around the campus.

Name: Baisakhi Das

There is a good canteen also where all type of food items can be found and our college also provides hostel and medical facilities. And sports facilities are also available for students and our college held sports competition also so that student can get some refreshments from their studies. Name: AMULYA SHARMA

There is a nascent club, called Club 451, where we discuss various topics, books, etc. and group discussions are held every week.

Name: Nakum Divyeshbhai
College: Sardar Vallabhbhai National Institute of Technology - [SVNIT]

Review: There are 90% of students got placement every year. This college is provided very good placement offers and also college invites many companies on our campus so that's the reason every Scholer and even moderate students also can achieve a good job and good placement according to their skills. Here also teaching us how to develop the skills and knowledge of the business. There are many companies visited like L and T, Birla, Reliance, Tata, etc. In our college, the highest placement is around 56 lacks in computer science engineering field.

Name: Manish Khatri
Heading: SRM University, Delhi-NCR, Sonepat (BTech in CS)
Review: The course curriculum is as per the UGC specifications and covers most of the theoretical topics of CS and most of the faculty members are good in teaching but there always exists some that do not provide good teaching. computer science is my passion so I opted for the program which was having a faculty: student ratio of 1:50. The faculties are highly qualified and have a good teaching method. The exams are taken twice a year, may and December and are really easy for students who studied hard else exams will be hard.

Name: Neha

Review: The annual fest is PRISMA which comprises of a lot of events from singing to dancing, there are a lot of chances for all to avail some awards and win competitions. They have start night at the last day on which anh star is called and they give a live performance for which everyone stays excited. The technical fest is also organised every year by the university. Coming to the library, we have E-library and physical library too. University has all the most famous publishers of books that one requires to study. The classrooms are also very beautiful and fully AC with projectors and other facilities which make them smart classes. In the evening after university end, students can stay and play different sports, also they have a gym and other things also. There are many groups such as dance society, drama society, a singing society, and lots more which have an important role in the university functions and events. Also, students run their social media handles and all very nice.

Name: BISHAL PRABAL MOHANTY

Review: I had chosen Physics because I am very good at Math and Physics in my12th class. In my college, there are 5 faculty members available. And other 3lab assistance. But approximately every student clear the exam.

Name: Aravind CJ

Review:
The faculty members were very experienced and nice to all students. They were very friendly and kind towards everyone.
They will clear your doubts whenever you need them. I chose this course because I am interested in tech videos and know the development of the technological world. There will be a fair amount of time to prepare for the exams and it will be a little too difficult to clear.

Name: Paresh Kumar Sahoo
Heading: SUIIT in Nutshell
Review: There are two annual fest SUIIT organises every year. One is INNOVATE, an annual technical fest and another one is AVAHAN, annual cultural fest. And many other social groups run by students like photography club, rocketry club and coding club etc.

Name: Nidhi
College: IIT Ropar - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITR]
Heading: Review of a VLSI PhD scholar
Review: Good for circuit designers and all faculty for vlsi is from IIT bombay. Nice exposure available here and faculty give attention to scholars. Near to you home city. Admission was based on gate score followed by written exam and finally selection was made on the basis of interview.

Name: Poojan shah
College: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Institute of Technology - [SVIT] Vasad
Heading: MY REVIEW
Review: I have chosen this course because I wanted to opt for it for a better future. Although I developed an interest in this particular field during my 10th standard and was very enthusiastic to learn about it. Talking about the faculties of our college, I must say that SVIT has got really good faculty as they are highly qualified and always want their students to be "doubtless" in their respective teaching subjects by solving each and everyone doubts possible. The faculty-student ratio is about 1:40 approx. Moving towards how timely the term exams were and how difficult was to pass it , they were on time as mid semester exams and GTU exams are conducted in 3 months and 6 months respectively. If one has sincerely studied during the lectures and also self-studied enough then it might not appear to be that difficult.

Name: ZUBIN JAMES KRISHNENDU PALIT

Although I being in the 2020 BATCH, haven't witnessed one, but it's a well-known fact that RIVIERA is one of the best. The next is the tech-fest -  GRAVITAS. It's an extraordinary plethora of events and exhibitions and workshops. The VIT library is huge. It's a 3-storey building and is filled with books on different fields. Some noteworthy technical clubs and chapters are DSC, IEEE, ISTE, CODECHEF and ROBOTICS.

Name: Umme Asma

The faculty is quite Qualified as most of the teaching members are research scholars and PhD holders. The teaching method is above average as most of the teachers are quite qualified. The termly exams are held timely and it's neither too easy nor way too difficult to pass for most of the subjects.

Name: Shalin Santosh

The libraries, labs, auditoriums, halls, sports court, canteen, hostels, etc. The facilities are also provided within the campus. There are lots of events, seminars and webinars to excel the skills of the students and make them active.

There are plenty of PGs available around the college to cut the cost of living. As the college is in the city center students also work part-time near the college as tutors, artists, etc. Overall it's an affordable college with an easy scoring system and has good infrastructure facilities on the campus

scholarship name: TS-EPASS which will cover all your college fee and hostel fee too.
If you are eligible for it
Eligibility: annual income of your father should be less than 2lac per annum in the urban area and less the 1.5lac per annum in the rural area.

The batch size in the Mumbai campus is 60. And all general mgmt subjects are taught in the first trimester.
The faculty are internal as well as guest faculty with industry experience. If you are eager to learn, the faculty will leave no stone unturned to give you relevant opportunities.
Most faculties have a PhD and ~10 years of teaching experience.
You will have 2 midterm tests and 1 final exam. Midterms are for internal marks along with the final projects you will be doing.
Many assignments help you understand the subject better.
If you pay attention and try to be practical with the theory taught to you, passing exams is quite easy.

He is a practitioner of Lean, Kaizen, 6 Sigma & gave us many real life experiences & also industry visits even in this pandemic. Dr Kaustubh Darghalkar (KD Sir) is a favourite of every student in BD.
